Report this job Planted helps people grow their careers. We are looking for a passionate, analytical, and creative marketing operations manager to further accelerate our growth. You’ll be at the heart of our marketing efforts, working to define and own the strategy, processes, metrics, and technology that will enable our organization to target the right buyers, generate high-quality leads, and help move them down the funnel. You will own, administer and build upon our existing websites and marketing technology stack to scale and optimize our marketing efforts and grow our business. This role is highly strategic, analytical and data-oriented and is suited for someone unafraid to work in a rapidly growing startup environment. Responsibilities    Own, administer, optimize and build upon our websites, Salesforce, and marketing automation tool stack    Perform marketing data analysis and translate them into strategic and tactical insights to optimize stages of the conversion funnel    Develop a strategic roadmap for SEO and marketing automation, including implementation of new marketing tools    Own the marketing infrastructure for various automated marketing campaigns, including attribution, campaign workflow, asset development, segmentation, and reporting    Collaborate with marketing team to develop and implement new website content, campaigns (e.g. email marketing), landing pages and demand generation strategies    Optimize nurture paths/email programs at various stages of customer lifecycle    Drive productivity by simplification of processes and implementation of automation tools    Optimize lead to cash end to end workflow efficiency related to Marketing and Sales transactions to and from Salesforce and integrated business applications    Accurately track lead generation through campaign names and CRM reports    Maintain marketing automation best practices including list management, optimization, data quality and hygiene, and troubleshooting   Experience    3+ years of experience in in a fast-paced, demand generation focused marketing organization, ideally at a SaaS company    Experience in website administration and various CMS applications (e.g. Instapage, Wordpress, etc.)    Applicable knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery preferred    Excellent analytical skills and experience measuring data-driven marketing programs    Advanced understanding and use of Google AdWords, Google Webmaster Tools, Google Search Console, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager    Knowledge and execution of SEO strategy    Experience integrating Salesforce with other third-party applications such as Zendesk, Intercom, Mailchimp, HubSpot, and Marketo    Google analytics, Salesforce, and HubSpot experience for goals, attribution and BI purposes    Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Management, Analytics, Operations, Economics, Computer Science, or related field    Certification in Salesforce preferred   Personal Characteristics    Analytical – can find meaning in numbers, and be a data-driven decision-maker    Excellent communicator – written and oral     Excellent time management and organizational skills    Adept at learning web-based tools    Resourceful. Figures out how to achieve results creatively with finite resources    Thrives in a nimble, lean, unstructured, fast-paced startup     Works collaboratively and energetically    Impeccable integrity and ethical standards. Self-aware, accepting, honest, open, polite and respectful of others    Ability to create and execute on processes for a growing SaaS startup using best practices. Report this job We are looking for an ambitious  Human Resources Generalist  to join our team at  CrossCountry Freight Solutions ! As a HR Generalist, you will be responsible for overseeing, managing and administering our employees' rewards, perks and benefits. Your role will be extremely important as you will be developing programs that will improve performance, engagement and satisfaction of our employees. Essential Job Duties:   Manages benefit programs including annual open enrollment.   Reconciles invoices for accuracy.   Responsible for HR compliance and filing requirements such as 5500’s, eeo-1, 1095’s.    Design a compensation package based on business goals and strategy.   Create a consistent compensation guideline that matches our work and organizational culture.   Create and analyze job descriptions evaluations and classifications with leadership involvement.   Conduct salary and labor market research to define benchmarks.   Ensure that compensation practices are in compliance with current laws and regulations.   Conduct periodic audits, prepare and present reports.   Manages unemployment correspondence.   Completes verification of employment.   Requirements:   Previous working experience as a compensation and benefits specialist for 5 years.   Prior experience in HR operations and knowledge of best practices.   Hands on experience with HR software (HRIS).   Hands on experience with quantitative and qualitative research.   Strong interpersonal and communication skills.   BA in Human Resources, Business Administration or similar relevant field.   SHRM/HRCI certification preferred.   About Us:  CrossCountry Freight Solutions (CCFS) is an innovator in the LTL trucking industry, with over 40 years of experience. CCFS uses the latest technology to provide quality service and on-time delivery to its customers. The company is proud to serve customers in North Dakota, South Dakota, Minnesota, Iowa, Kansas, Nebraska, Wisconsin, Illinois, Missouri, Colorado, Wyoming, and Montana. CCFS is a member of the North American family of companies. Our family of companies provide direct service throughout the Upper Midwest, and Western regions; along with parts of the Southwest region. Report this job Administrative Assistant - AdmissionsThe University of Mary is seeking applications for an Administrative Assistant. The position assists the Undergraduate Admissions department in their administrative efforts to recruit students and to build a strong student population.Candidates will be invited to demonstrate a willingness to support the Christian, Catholic, Benedictine mission of the University of Mary.Essential Roles and Responsibilities Include:+ Assists in organizing student visits and acts as a liaison between departments. Arranges catering requests, caterers, room reservations for visiting families, and organizes staff from various departments. Responsible for ordering adequate supplies and materials for mailings, college fairs, and admission events.+ Arranges student tour guides to escort prospective students and their families around the campus and answers basic inquiries+ Assists in implementing major events such as SOAR (Student Orientation Advisement & Registration), scholarship events, and annual meetings with local educational institutions+ Accurately processes Daily Procedure in alignment with standard admissions protocol to generate time-sensitive letters to prospective students+ Provides superior customer service by greeting guests in a professional, friendly, and hospitable manner. Ensures all phone calls are answered promptly and redirected accordingly. Receives, sorts, and forwards incoming mail and email. This may include web-based inquiries, visits, and electronic transcripts.Desired Minimum Qualifications, Education, and Experience include:+ Required: Associate?s degree with two years of related experience+ Preferred: Bachelor?s degree with one year experience in an admissions environment+ Upholds and supports the Christian, Catholic, Benedictine mission of the University of Mary+ Supports the ongoing implementation of Ex Corde Ecclesiae, the apostolic constitution on Catholic colleges and universities+ Builds a culture of ready and earnest hospitality in the Office of Enrollment Management and throughout the university, in accord with Saint Benedict?s admonition that all be received as ChristKnowledge and Skills Required:+ Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite applications+ Ability to quickly learn other department-related software and databases+ Ability to organize and effectively communicate with the public+ Able to meet the needs of our students, including a high degree of confidentiality, integrity and discretion.We thank you for your interest in the University of Mary. Founded in 1959 by the Sisters of Annunciation Monastery, the campus overlooks the beautiful Missouri river and is located in Bismarck, North Dakota, a community of approximately 80,000 people, with wonderful family and parish life, friendly neighborhoods, enjoyable recreational and cultural facilities, a low crime rate, clean air, and excellent schools. The University of Mary, with an enrollment of over 3,000 students, is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission of the North Central Association.For more information on the University of Mary, please watch a short video by clicking on this link: e/Go37Hy6QrVsTo apply; click here or go to umary.edu.Review of application materials will begin immediately. Report this job Direct message the job poster from Dakota Pro Football Bismarck Bucks Professional Indoor Football League at Dakota Pro Football LLC. POSITION SUMMARY  The Corporate Hospitality Manager is responsible for cultivating relationships with North Dakota businesses with a focus on developing unique curated opportunities to include the football experience, corporate tours on game-day and traditional football hospitality packages at Bucks games.  The candidate should be a self-motivated, entrepreneurial and a positive professional with experience in planning and executing prospecting events, as well as sales generation. The Corporate Hospitality Manager will be located in the Bismarck office and will work under the guidance of the General Manager About the Organization:  The Bucks are part of the Indoor Football League (IFL), the largest indoor football league in the United States, with teams ranging from California to Wisconsin, including teams throughout the Midwest. The team will play a 16-game schedule in 2021, with their eight home games at the Bismarck Event Center. Bucks management is dedicated to providing fun, family entertainment at affordable prices to the Bismarck, Mandan communities.  Start Date: ASAP  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Primary duties to include, but not limited to the following: Research, analyze, and develop special event profit-generating opportunities, leveraging Football Operation assets for non-game day related experiences Proactively solicit new business by, among other things, making sales calls and presentations, attending local trade shows, and engaging in other client prospecting in order to increase the size of the Bucks potential client database Create leads and develop long-term relationships in the event planning, production, and promotion communities, monitor changes and new developments in the special events industry Entertain and nurture relationships with clients and prospects through creative means including but not limited to: networking events, speaking engagements, one-on-one dinners / lunches, prospect sampling at games, seat visits at games and outside meetings Perform accurate and skilled deal closings while exceeding established yearly revenue and corporate hospitality goals set for new business Work collaboratively with multiple departments on all operational aspects of executing our hospitality experiences Manage and direct all organization-related event logistics, including managing the events calendar, conducting walk-throughs and stadium visits, and being the primary contact for clients Prepare and provide required reports to the project General Manager including special event revenue reports, profit and loss statements, sales recaps, and projections Obtain feedback from clients following each special event to determine and analyze client satisfaction QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and related experience/training 3-5 years of relevant hospitality/special events sales experience Resourceful, innovative and forward thinking, with an entrepreneurial spirit Strong interpersonal skills; can effectively communicate and relate to all levels within and outside the organization; creates and builds positive and productive relationships Proficient in financial analysis and planning, budgeting, and marketing Working knowledge of local and regional markets, venue operations, and special events industries Ability to effectively evaluate risks and liabilities of special events Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously; responds quickly and effectively to changing trends and circumstances Ability to manage appropriate steps to get projects completed; has strong abilities to organize people and processes; can create a plan for resourceful workflow Proficient in Microsoft Office, with a focus on Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Previous working experience with a CRM system Must have strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to work in a fast pace and dynamic environment Other projects as assigned Assist other departments when requested COMPENSATION Competitive salary with experience We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Report this job Editor Description We are the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment, powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people. Purpose of this position The editor is responsible for executing editorial standards and protocol for all core, offline, and elective online courses (lessons, assessments, multimedia, and ancillary materials). Core Tasks And Responsibilities   Performs the duties, which include providing expertise on editorial style, standards, and processes; defining and updating the corporate editorial conventions to ensure that they evolve with changes in reputable, widely accepted editorial manuals; and evolving editorial processes to adapt to product needs in an Agile environment   Examines, researches, and resolves editorial issues; addresses escalated issues; responds to team members’ concerns; oversees editorial workload, productivity, and quality; and identifies and oversees work process improvement   Works with Manager of Editorial to define editorial styles and conventions that are accurate and evolve with changes in reputable, widely accepted editorial manuals (stays current on editorial trends)   Works with a cross-functional Agile team to complete projects and features   Becomes an expert with OBL’s editorial style guide and industry guidelines such as  The Chicago Manual of Style  to perform editorial functions to ensure content is accurate, consistent, etc.   Key relationships   Works with the Product Development managers to ensure the development of high-quality curricula and resources   Proposes and implements new ways of working or procedures within own area   Negotiates resources within team and may negotiate across teams to agree on common objectives   Maintains effective relationships within own and related areas   Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position can expect a starting salary range of $42,000-$48,000, and are eligible to participate in an annual incentive plan. Benefits available to eligible employees can be seen at: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/ Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Report this job Overview Since 1885, CHI St. Alexius Health has been dedicated to leading health care in this region by enriching the lives of patients through the highest quality of care. We seek to continue our tradition of success and innovation with individuals dedicated to delivering the highest level of expertise and quality. Together we can continue to grow and support the legacy of CHI St. Alexius Health for many years to come. CHI St. Alexius Health is a regional health network with a tertiary hospital in Bismarck, the system also consists of critical access hospitals (CAHs) in Carrington, Dickinson, Devils Lake, Garrison, Turtle Lake, Washburn and Williston and numerous clinics and outpatient services. CHI St. Alexius Health manages four CAHs in North Dakota - Elgin, Linton, and Wishek, as well as Mobridge Regional Medical Center in Mobridge, S. D. CHI St. Alexius Health offers a comprehensive line of inpatient and outpatient medical services, including: a Level II Trauma Center, primary and specialty physician clinics, home health and hospice services, durable medical equipment services, a fitness and human performance center and ancillary services throughout western and central North Dakota. CHI St. Alexius Health is part of CommonSpirit Health, a nonprofit, Catholic health system dedicated to advancing health for all people. It was created in February 2019 through the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives and Dignity Health. CommonSpirit Health is committed to creating healthier communities, delivering exceptional patient care, and ensuring every person has access to quality health care. Responsibilities Works under the supervision of the Safety & Emergency Management Coordinator. This individual is responsible for assisting individuals interacting with the Medical Center. Essential Duties And Responsibilities Successfully completed the defined job specific competencies, including competency for age specific, as appropriate. Provide the first impression of the facility and pleasantly and promptly greet, receive, direct, and escort patients and visitors to areas and departments within the facility and campus. Respond to all individuals interacting with the Medical Center for services, including employees, visitors, professional associates, students and vendors with activity and contact information.  Begin registration process by verifying identity and researching appointment time and location.  Answer phone, transfer and forward calls, page personnel as directed, manage the distribution of mail, messages, deliveries and other items brought to the desk. Provide telephone assistance during emergency situations. Provide assistance to patients and visitors by responding to a wide variety of questions from patients, visitors and staff.  Assist with patient and visitor requests for outside transportation and accommodation.  Demonstrate and promote effective interdepartmental communication by participation in cooperative efforts to maximize utilization of resources. Assist with orientation of new staff members including review of organization privacy and HIPPA guidelines for releasing patient directory information. Maintain an efficient and organized Patient Services Desk by ensuring customer satisfaction by courteous, confidential service. Responsible for maintaining neat and orderly reception area environment. Qualifications QUALIFICATIONS: Education High School graduate or equivalent and preferably w/ entry level college courses. Experience Experience with registration systems, word processing, spreadsheet applications or Internet knowledge is preferred. Skills Ability to operate phone system and assess information through computerized registration and scheduling system. CommonSpirit Health participates in E-verify. Report this job Summary Of Work The Department of Career and Technical Education is seeking a positive, enthusiastic individual to serve as the manager for special projects. Major Responsibilities Are Coordinate distance career and technical education delivery.    Monitor interactive distance career and technical education in the state to determine gaps and duplication and provide recommendations to the state director.     Facilitate partnerships between the different providers, such as ND Center for Distance Education, CTE Area Career and Technology Centers, Interactive Television Consortiums, Institutions of Higher Education and Dept. of Career and Technical Education staff.     Provide and coordinate technical assistance to administrators, teachers and counselors on distance education strategies.  Manage special projects assigned by the state director included, but not limited to:    Develop and manage a statewide CTE work-based learning system     Expand and manage a statewide CTE dual credit system     Coordinate CTE Teacher Retention projects     Write grant proposals and manage grants  Other duties as assigned. This position entails travel both in-state travel and some out of the state. Minimum Qualifications The position requires a Bachelor’s degree and four years of program administration, program development, or teaching experience. Candidate must possess good written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to demonstrate group presentation skills. Must have the ability to operate a computer using Microsoft Office. A valid driver’s license is required with the ability to travel from one location to another both within and outside the state on their own. Preferred Qualifications    Bachelor's degree in Education; or Master's degree in Education or Administration.     E xperience in distance education delivery and career and technical education.     Demonstrated ability to plan and to work with a wide range of constituents including instructors, administrators, and the public.   Application Procedures  Applications must be submitted online along with a cover letter, resume, copy of college transcripts, and a minimum of three (3) professional references and their contact information. The cover letter must clearly explain how the applicant’s work experience is related to the description of duties and responsibilities, minimum qualifications and level of work experience. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Sponsorships will not be provided. For information about the position or for persons needing accommodation or assistance in the application or interview process, contact Brenda Schuler at 701-328-3181.  Equal Employment Opportunity  The State of North Dakota and this hiring agency do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex (including sexual orientation and gender identity), genetics, religion, age or disability in employment or the provisions of services and complies with the provisions of the North Dakota Human Rights Act. As an employer, the State of North Dakota prohibits smoking in all places of state employment in accordance with N.D.C.C.  23-12-10. Report this job Job Description The Operations Manager is a member of the Store Management team, and as such, fulfills the company purpose of helping people on their path to better health by driving store execution and performance while building consumer loyalty to CVS/pharmacy through a focus on excellent customer service. Under the supervision of the Store Manager, the Operations Manager will maintain an engaged, productive store team through strong leadership, demonstrating initiative and leading by example. Responsiblities The Operations Manager is responsible for supporting the Store Manager in the total leadership and strategic operation of a CVS/pharmacy store including  Overall store management, supervision, and policy implementation  Sales and inventory management  Employee staffing, training, and development  Financial management  Customer service leadership Unlike the Store Manager in Training position, the Operations Manager position is not part of the CVS/pharmacy Retail Management Development Program. Operations Managers are not eligible for direct promotion to Store Manager. Candidates with a short-term goal of becoming a CVS Store Manager should instead apply for Store Manager in Training openings. Essential Functions  Management  Lead others and work effectively with store crews  Supervise, assign and direct activities of the store’s crew  Effectively communicate information to store crew and supervisors in an open and timely manner  Support Store Manager with actions plans for operational and service improvement  Customer Service  Assist customers with their questions, problems and complaints  Promote CVS customer service culture (greet, offer help, and thank) <s Required Qualifications   Deductive reasoning ability, advanced analytical skills and computer skills.  Advanced communication skills, leadership, supervision, and influencing skill  Ability to work a full-time flexible schedule, including some early morning, overnight and weekend shifts, to work overtime as needed, and to respond to urgent issues at the store when they arise  Preferred Qualifications   Experience as a retail manager or supervisor Education   High school diploma or equivalent required Business Overview At CVS Health, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart. We strive to promote and sustain a culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging every day. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, sex/gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability or protected veteran status or on any other basis or characteristic prohibited by applicable federal, state, or local law. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities. Production Media Manager Job Description The Production Media Manager is responsible for all operation of multimedia production/post-production and live streaming of webinars, conferences, and live events: this includes, but is not limited to, the artistic design and setup of the venues and recording spaces, support, training, and maintenance related to managing and maintaining the university’s multimedia technology, venue areas, conference rooms, classrooms, and production spaces. They will work collaboratively across the University to investigate, promote, and support new and existing technologies that enhance teaching, learning and research through media production. They will also work closely with the Office of Public Affairs to ensure the brand standards of the university are met. This position is also responsible for multimedia production in support of online course design, lectures, seminars, and any events held for private and public consumption. In addition, it is the responsibility of the Production Media Manager to archive and preserve data files for both historical and disaster recovery purposes. This position is also responsible for support of the A/V technology located at UMary, and manages the Media Production Technicians and the Media Production Student Assistants. The Production Media Manager position reports directly to the CIO. Responsibilities: Clearly communicates and develops production plans for each live event or production. Develops and maintains a production calendar ensuring that equipment is available for production and classroom use as needed. Audio, video, photographic, and digital production, and post-production of UMARY lectures, labs, live events, presentations, and meetings for dissemination to students, staff, and faculty Editing of raw footage and creation of high-quality video content Design and creation of audio, graphics, and editing into finished content Supports the designs and assists in the implementation of online courses. Records special events as requested by University staff Receives, reviews, prioritizes, and ensures completion of all requests for media services Ensures that recordings are transferred to video streaming server as needed or requested by faculty Archives and preserves data files for both historical and disaster recovery purposes Research new media-based educational technologies and works with the academics on selection and implementation Maintains inventory and manages life cycle of all production equipment and spaces. Drives customer satisfaction and demonstrates strong customer service orientation. Demonstrates effective interpersonal, communication, and conflict resolution skills. Authors technical documentation and ensures that it is updated to remain current. Provides one-on-one user training as needed. Assists with the daily scheduling of technology usage. Sets-up classroom A/V equipment to meet faculty needs, which include computer, video recording and projection needs. Trouble-shoots repair requests in a timely manner Performs operational check-ups of classroom A/V equipment. Performs or arranges repair of equipment as needed Monitor supply inventory and equipment. Research new technology and acquires supplies and equipment as needed Provides consultation on the updating of classroom technology Assists with the implementation and training of operation to faculty and staff employees Records classes as needed or requested by faculty Assists with management of supplies inventory and equipment Research alternative supplies and equipment costs Rents equipment as needed Assists with the implementation and training of operation to faculty and staff employees Oversees and manages Media Production staff. Performs staff management functions including staff performance appraisals Ensures policies and procedures are administered properly and problem resolution is achieved within stated service levels Assists with the development of department policies, budgets, plans, quotes, and requisitions. Supervise employees and student workers as applicable Responds to faculty, student, and staff requests for support as it relates to IT supported A/V and media production equipment and systems Works with vendors on issue resolution of third-party supported applications Resolves issues from distance learning Helpdesk requests Trains and assists faculty with proper integration of technology in the classroom Other duties as assigned Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in communications, media production, related field, or an equivalent combination of experience, education, and training Experience and understanding of media management At least 3 years’ experience in post/live media production Demonstrated experience with industry standard audio/visual hardware and software. Understanding of media in teaching and learning. Experience with streaming and web distribution is preferred. Proficiency with creating, editing, and producing audio, video and photographic media is required. Report this job Job Information As a Business Analyst you will evaluate business operations to understand gaps and opportunities through development and analysis of reports in the Aftermarket Parts, Service, and Attachment division of Doosan Bobcat. This position is responsible for analyzing requirements and recommending solutions which enable the business unit to achieve goals within established strategies. The ideal candidate for this role works well in an autonomous environment and is detail oriented, highly analytical, and inquisitive. Role & Responsibility   Provide accurate, timely and informative business information and insights to key-decision makers within the company.   Perform audits of master data.   Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.   Provide business and systems expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing specifications and procedures that meet user requirements.   Train users to utilize reporting and decision-making models.   Gather user feedback for enhancements and development needs.   Job Requirement   Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.   Experience: 2>5 years.   High degree of math and statistical skills/understanding.   Oracle experience preferred.   Data mining and analytics experience preferred.   High degree of fluency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint.   Must have a high level of motivation and individual initiative.   Excellent analytical/problem solving skills, communication skills.   Travel: <15%.   Doosan Bobcat North America will not sponsor applicants for work visas, nor provide any OPT, CPT or other immigration support, for this position. #zrco #gd Doosan Bobcat, a leading global manufacturer of construction, agriculture and landscaping equipment, attachments and services, is committed to empowering people to accomplish more. As a part of the Doosan Group, which employs more than 43,000 people in 38 countries worldwide, the company offers its customers products and solutions to help build stronger businesses and communities. Based in Seoul, South Korea, with its North America headquarters in West Fargo, North Dakota, Doosan Bobcat is home to world-renowned brands. This includes: Bobcat® compact equipment; Doosan Portable Power products; BOB-CAT Mowers; Ryan and Steiner grounds care equipment; and Geith attachments. At Doosan Bobcat, our success is powered by our people. Through our winning culture and one global team working together, we deliver the best products and service to our customers – and make the world a better place. Join our team today and start building your career with a worldwide leader. Doosan is committed to a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, religion, creed, citizenship status, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by law. Individuals with disabilities who require a reasonable accommodation in the application process or who need assistance accessing the information on this website should call 701-241-8700. Doosan is a VEVRAA federal contractor and seeks priority referrals of protected veterans. Beware of Fraudulent Job Offers and Solicitations Any legitimate job offer will be preceded by an official selection process. Report this job Job Description Spherion Staffing has an opening for an experienced HR Generalist in Bismarck, ND. The Human Resource Generalist will advise, coach, counsel and provide guidance to managers and employees on policies, procedures, programs, employee relations, performance management and other human resources areas. The HR Generalist will assist in the day-to-day operations and coverage of the Human Resource department; assist in the administration and communication of benefits plans and programs. Qualified applicants should have minimum of 5 years' experience in compensation and benefits, BA in HR and SHRM/HRCI certification preferred. Pay $16-25/hour DOE Schedule: M-F, 8-5pm Responsibilities:  Manage benefit programs including annual open enrollment  Reconcile invoices for accuracy  Responsible for HR compliance and filing requirements such as 5500's, eeo-1, 1095's  Design a compensation package based on business goals and strategy  Create a consistent compensation guideline that matches our work and organizational culture  Create and analyze job descriptions evaluations and classifications with leadership involvement  Conduct salary and labor market research to define benchmarks  Assess employees needs by conducting organizational surveys  Keep abreast with new trend and best practice in the filed  Ensure that compensation practices are in compliance with current laws and regulations  Conduct periodic audits, prepare and present reports  Manage unemployment correspondence  Complete verification of employment Responsibilities: See above Working hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM Skills: Requirements: BA in human resources, business administration or similar relevant field SHRM/HRCI certification preferred Minimum of 5 years' experience in compensation and benefits Good understanding of full cycle hiring process Familiarity with current employment rules and regulations Hands on experience with HR software (HRIS) Hands on experience with quantitative and qualitative research Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Education: Bachelors Experience: 4-7 years Qualifications: See above To be considered, please apply online at www.spherion.com/apply or if you have questions you can reach out to John Funk at 701-298-8300 Spherion has helped thousands of people just like you find work happiness! Our experienced staff will listen carefully to your employment needs and then work diligently to match your skills and qualifications to the right job and company. No one works harder for you than Spherion. EEO Employer: Race, Religion, Color, National Origin, Citizenship, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, Age, Disability, Ancestry, Veteran Status, Genetic Information, Service in the Uniformed Services or any other classification protected by law. Your job seeking activity is only visible to you. Email Continue Welcome back  to save  Logistics Coordinator  at  CLOVERDALE FOODS COMPANY, INC. . Email or phone Password Show Forgot password?  Report this job Direct message the job poster from CLOVERDALE FOODS COMPANY, INC. Cloverdale Foods Cloverdale is a family owned company for over 100 years. We don't just craft fine meats, we make memories.  Summary: As the Logistics Coordinator with Cloverdale Foods Company, you will have the opportunity to cultivate relationships and provide innovative delivery solutions to our customers, helping them to achieve their goals and, in return, yours! Come experience a world where servant leadership and cutting-edge tools and training come together to support your career growth and financial objectives. The logistics coordinator facilitates communication between the stages of production, sales, warehousing, and distribution to promote a healthy and efficient supply chain by using a combination of experience, soft skills, and industry knowledge of best practices. A successful logistics coordinator should ensure cost-effective supply chain operations while also promptly resolving distribution issues, actively seeking and developing new opportunities and solutions.     Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Manage logistics team (transportation, inventory control, and customer service) to safely and efficiently meet required daily activities. Route optimization and coordination of transportation providers to ensure prompt and proper movement of shipments. Assist in management of distribution and shipment budgets. Planning schedule for Shipping and Receiving docks. Effectively resolve and communicate issues with customers concerning operational and logistical issues, improving processes as needed Create weekly freight invoices and complete monthly analysis, tracking and fixing shipping errors. Creatively reach out to carriers to build relationships. Discover the most cost-effective shipping solutions that meet our high service level standards. Evaluate vendor operations according to quality and safety standards. Present capacity solutions to effectively support go-to-market strategy. Develop processes that make the supply chain more efficient and organized. Resolve problems through data analysis and by identifying issues, thinking critically, seeking input to determine the best course of action, and implementing solutions. Manage and update carrier and route information and paperwork. Skills: Ability to lead, supervise, and coach team members. Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Ability to multitask. Ability to deal effectively with different personalities in high stress situations. Ability to work under critical deadlines and heavy workloads with minimal supervision. Strong verbal and written communication, negotiation and organizational skills. Plan, organize, and prioritize your own work effectively. Organizational skills with unfailing attention to detail. Microsoft Applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point). Qualifications:   Associates degree in Logistics, Business Administration, Marketing, Hospitality or related industry. Bachelor’s degree preferred. Minimum 2 years’ experience within the foodservice or logistics industry that includes quantifiable success in a management role. Ability and willingness to work flexible hours, including some weekends. Ability to read, write and speak English proficiently. Bilingual skills a plus.  Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an Employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; stand; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear.  Work Environment:  The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an Employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Report this job Ormco, headquartered in Brea, CA, is a global leader and innovator of orthodontic products and solutions to enhance the lives of our customers and their patients. For nearly 60 years, Ormco has partnered with the orthodontic community to help create over 20 million smiles in over 130 countries. Distinguished products range from twin brackets (Symetri Clear, Titanium Orthos and Mini Diamond) to pioneering the self-ligating appliances with the Damon System (including Damon Q2 and Damon Clear 2). Ormcos Insignia Advanced Smile Design provides an all-inclusive customized indirect bonding solution for increased clinical efficiency. Spark Clear Aligner System is designed to meet the needs of the orthodontist with the TruGEN material and 3D Approver software. From personalized service to professional education programs and marketing support, Ormco is committed to helping orthodontists achieve their clinical and practice management objectives.Operating Company:OrmcoJob Description:Responsible for growth and expansion of direct sales and profit margins within assigned accounts and/or territory/region on products or services. Establishes professional relationships with key personnel in customer accounts. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume and margin dollars.Job Requirements:Envista and all Envista Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The EEO is the Law poster is available at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/ compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.Envista is a global family of more than 30 trusted dental brands, united by a shared purpose: to partner with professionals to improve lives. Envista helps its customers deliver the best possible patient care through industry-leading dental consumables, solutions, technology, and services. Our comprehensive portfolio, including dental implants and treatment options, orthodontics, and digital imaging technologies, covers an estimated 90% of dentists' clinical needs for diagnosing, treating, and preventing dental conditions as well as improving the aesthetics of the human smile. Envista companies, including KaVo, Kerr, Nobel Biocare, Implant Direct and Ormco, partner with dental professionals to help them deliver the best possible patient care.Envista separated from Danaher as an independent company in 2019. We brought with us the proven Envista Business System (EBS) methodology, an experienced leadership team, and a strong culture grounded in continuous improvement, commitment to innovation, and deep customer focus to meet the end-to-end needs of dental professionals worldwide. Envista is now one of the largest global dental products companies, with significant market positions in some of the most attractive segments of the dental products industry. For more information, please visit www.envistaco.com . This National Guard position is for a PROGRAM ANALYST, Position Description Number  D1010000  and is part of the ND G1, National Guard. Responsibilities As a Program Analyst, you will serve as the analyst and consultant for the management and administration of programs within the directorate or division. MAJOR DUTIES (This Is NOT An All-inclusive List) Provides expert technical guidance and specialized team leadership to civilian and military employees. Plans, organizes, performs technical analyses as required, and, as assigned, manages budget functions to support programs essential to state Army National Guard daily readiness missions. Utilizes particular areas of expertise to foster technical excellence in an environment conducive to teaming among service providers and customers to meet state Army National Guard requirements. Reviews, evaluates and analyzes obligations and expenditures. Based on budget guidance received from higher headquarters, develops an annual budget for programs. Develops, collects, and maintains various historical data used to initiate planning, programming and execution of current and future training and operations programs. Travel Required Occasional travel - You may be expected to travel for this position. Supervisory status No Promotion Potential 9    Job family (Series) Similar jobs   Requirements Conditions of Employment   NATIONAL GUARD MEMBERSHIP IS REQUIRED. If you are not sure you are eligible for military membership, please contact a National Guard recruiter prior to applying for this position.   This is an excepted service position that requires membership in a compatible military assignment in the employing state's National Guard, required prior to the effective date of placement.   Selectee will be required to wear the military uniform.   Acceptance of an excepted service position constitutes concurrence with these requirements as a condition of employment.   Applicants who are not currently a member of the National Guard must be eligible for immediate membership and employment in the National Guard in the military grade listed in this announcement.   Males born after 31 December 1959 must be registered for Selective Service.   Federal employment suitability as determined by a background investigation.   May be required to successfully complete a probationary period.   Participation in direct deposit is mandatory.   Must be able to obtain and maintain a secret security clearance.   Qualifications Military Grades :  Officers O1-O4; Warrant Officers, Enlisted  PCS STATEMENT: PERMANENT CHANGE OF STATION COSTS WILL NOT BE PAID FOR THIS POSITION. Verbiage displayed on your resume or application must contain your own words. SPECIALIZED EXPERIENCE : Must possess the required 24 months of specialized experience, which includes; 1.) Equal Employment Opportunity Policy The United States Government does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. Reasonable Accommodation Policy Federal agencies must provide reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities where appropriate. Applicants requiring reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process should follow the instructions in the job opportunity announcement. For any part of the remaining hiring process, applicants should contact the hiring agency directly. Determinations on requests for reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis. A reasonable accommodation is any change to a job, the work environment, or the way things are usually done that enables an individual with a disability to apply for a job, perform job duties or receive equal access to job benefits. Under the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, federal agencies must provide reasonable accommodations when:   An applicant with a disability needs an accommodation to have an equal opportunity to apply for a job.   An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to perform the essential job duties or to gain access to the workplace.   An employee with a disability needs an accommodation to receive equal access to benefits, such as details, training, and office-sponsored events.   You can request a reasonable accommodation at any time during the application or hiring process or while on the job. Requests are considered on a case-by-case basis. Report this job Overview: Since 1885, CHI St. Alexius Health has been dedicated to leading health care in this region by enriching the lives of patients through the highest quality of care. We seek to continue our tradition of success and innovation with individuals dedicated to delivering the highest level of expertise and quality. Together we can continue to grow and support the legacy of CHI St. Alexius Health for many years to come. CHI St. Alexius Health is a regional health network with a tertiary hospital in Bismarck, the system also consists of critical access hospitals (CAHs) in Carrington, Dickinson, Devils Lake, Garrison, Turtle Lake, Washburn and Williston and numerous clinics and outpatient services. CHI St. Alexius Health manages four CAHs in North Dakota - Elgin, Linton, and Wishek, as well as Mobridge Regional Medical Center in Mobridge, S. D. CHI St. Alexius Health offers a comprehensive line of inpatient and outpatient medical services, including: a Level II Trauma Center, primary and specialty physician clinics, home health and hospice services, durable medical equipment services, a fitness and human performance center and ancillary services throughout western and central North Dakota. CHI St. Alexius Health is part of CommonSpirit Health, a nonprofit, Catholic health system dedicated to advancing health for all people. It was created in February 2019 through the alignment of Catholic Health Initiatives and Dignity Health. CommonSpirit Health is committed to creating healthier communities, delivering exceptional patient care, and ensuring every person has access to quality health care.  Responsibilities  Works under the supervision of the Safety & Emergency Management Coordinator. This individual is responsible for assisting individuals interacting with the Medical Center. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Successfully completed the defined job specific competencies, including competency for age specific, as appropriate. Provide the first impression of the facility and pleasantly and promptly greet, receive, direct, and escort patients and visitors to areas and departments within the facility and campus. Respond to all individuals interacting with the Medical Center for services, including employees, visitors, professional associates, students and vendors with activity and contact information.  Begin registration process by verifying identity and researching appointment time and location.  Answer phone, transfer and forward calls, page personnel as directed, manage the distribution of mail, messages, deliveries and other items brought to the desk. Provide telephone assistance during emergency situations. Provide assistance to patients and visitors by responding to a wide variety of questions from patients, visitors and staff.  Assist with patient and visitor requests for outside transportation and accommodation.  Demonstrate and promote effective interdepartmental communication by participation in cooperative efforts to maximize utilization of resources. Assist with orientation of new staff members including review of organization privacy and HIPPA guidelines for releasing patient directory information. Maintain an efficient and organized Patient Services Desk by ensuring customer satisfaction by courteous, confidential service. Responsible for maintaining neat and orderly reception area environment.  Qualifications  QUALIFICATIONS: Education:  High School graduate or equivalent and preferably w/ entry level college courses. Experience:  Experience with registration systems, word processing, spreadsheet applications or Internet knowledge is preferred. Skills:  Ability to operate phone system and assess information through computerized registration and scheduling system. CommonSpirit Health participates in E-verify. Description: Customer Success Manager in Palghar Jobs People Learning Join now  Customer Success Manager Proofpoint Bismarck, ND Apply on company website Customer Success Manager Proofpoint Bismarck, ND 2 weeks ago Be among the first 25 applicants See who Proofpoint has hired for this role Apply on company website Save Save job Save this job with your existing LinkedIn profile, or create a new one. Your job seeking activity is only visible to you. Email Continue Welcome back  to save  Customer Success Manager  at  Proofpoint . Email or phone Password Show Forgot password?  Report this job It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. Proofpoint is looking for a self-starting, responsible, action-oriented, and highly motivated individual to join our growing field services team. The mission of the Customer Success Manager is to ensure that our customers realize the full value of the products and services they have purchased from Proofpoint, ultimately maximizing renewals and add-on transactions. This is a customer-centric role in a fast-paced environment that demands interaction with enterprises at senior levels, as well as with technical staff within the traditional IT and Security organization. Successful candidates will have excellent communication skills with a proven track record of successfully interacting with customers regarding business and technical interests alike; a strong technical foundation, especially related to security and messaging; substantial experience driving concurrent projects and issues to completion with little direction, and above all a passion for ensuring a world class customer experience. Responsibilities Include Drive high levels of customer success through post sales activities, maintaining a strong sense of ownership over assigned customer accounts. Be a relentless advocate for your customers into the Marketing and Engineering teams to improve the product and help ensure that Proofpoint deployments are successful. Independently provide ongoing and proactive vision and guidance regarding security initiatives to assigned Proofpoint customers. Provide guidance and advice to onboarding customers about how best to utilize Proofpoint resources including their purchased solutions, support options, training offerings and other Proofpoint services. Meet regularly with assigned customers, both remotely and on-site, to review product adoption and health, support interactions, major issues, upcoming releases, and other security initiatives. Develop a thorough understanding of customer’s business and security needs, providing proactive recommendations that support the customer’s roadmap and vision. Communicate consultatively about potential solutions to address customers’ security concerns and challenges. Manage and monitor support interactions, serving as an internal advocate for assigned customers, responding to customer escalations, and proactively escalating when needed. Lead crisis and incident response, working with multiple parties – internal departments as well as the customer - to ensure timely and satisfactory resolution to issues and project completion. Identify root causes of customer churn and possible client dissatisfaction. Engage appropriate team members from cross functional groups such as Sales, Marketing, Engineering, Support, and Professional Services to help address underlying causes of churn and dissatisfaction. Develop and oversee individual strategies to help meet Proofpoint’s customers’ requirements for success. Plan and lead process improvement initiatives tailored to improve overall customer success and satisfaction during a customer’s journey with the Proofpoint team.  Requirements 4-year college degree in a business area, technical area or equivalent 5+ years of industry experience in a client/professional services, sales engineer, senior support engineer, or other customer facing role with exposure to multiple technology areas Understand and demonstrate customer success principles and behavior Must be able to articulate customer business requirements and serve as the customer voice internally Extensive knowledge of data communication concepts and technologies, specifically email, networking, and enterprise security Working knowledge of Linux, SMTP, MySQL, Windows, Active Directory and Microsoft Exchange Ability to effectively work in a team environment as well as independently Excellent communication skills, phone manner, and meeting presence with all levels of customer leadership Strong project and/or program management skills and high attention to detail, with a solid understanding of project management methodologies Ability to think innovatively, strategically and deliver tactically Ability to work independently, ability to adapt quickly, positive attitude Travel  Minimal to light travel (0 to 25%) If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us! Position Summary: Under the direction of the Manager of Organizational Development, the Organizational Development Specialist II is responsible for working closely with internal business partners to identify, develop and implement training courses and programs. This individual designs and delivers practical value-added employee training and performance solutions. This includes but is not limited to: working with individuals, teams, departments, and the organization as a whole, to facilitate change and increase performance effectiveness, engagement and retention. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Education and/or Experience: BA or BS in Training and Development, Organization Development or related field and/or 4 to 7 years of combined experience is required. Experience in (ADDIE) design and delivery of systems/functional and professional skills training is strongly preferred. Experience utilizing a learning management system is required. Report this job Editor Description We are the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment, powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people. Purpose of this position The editor is responsible for executing editorial standards and protocol for all core, offline, and elective online courses (lessons, assessments, multimedia, and ancillary materials). Core Tasks And Responsibilities   Performs the duties, which include providing expertise on editorial style, standards, and processes; defining and updating the corporate editorial conventions to ensure that they evolve with changes in reputable, widely accepted editorial manuals; and evolving editorial processes to adapt to product needs in an Agile environment   Examines, researches, and resolves editorial issues; addresses escalated issues; responds to team members’ concerns; oversees editorial workload, productivity, and quality; and identifies and oversees work process improvement   Works with Manager of Editorial to define editorial styles and conventions that are accurate and evolve with changes in reputable, widely accepted editorial manuals (stays current on editorial trends)   Works with a cross-functional Agile team to complete projects and features   Becomes an expert with OBL’s editorial style guide and industry guidelines such as  The Chicago Manual of Style  to perform editorial functions to ensure content is accurate, consistent, etc.   Key relationships   Works with the Product Development managers to ensure the development of high-quality curricula and resources   Proposes and implements new ways of working or procedures within own area   Negotiates resources within team and may negotiate across teams to agree on common objectives   Maintains effective relationships within own and related areas   Colorado-based individuals expressing interest in this position can expect a starting salary range of $42,000-$48,000, and are eligible to participate in an annual incentive plan. Benefits available to eligible employees can be seen at: https://pearsonbenefitsus.com/ Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Qualifications Training/competencies   Solves problems by identifying and selecting solutions using acquired technical expertise   Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience   Communicates highly complex information to colleagues in a way that can be easily understood   Makes operational or moderately complex decisions without guidance   Experience   Bachelor's degree   Minimum 3 years editorial experience, including experience editing & improving digital products   Experience of project management in a multi-disciplined and commercial environment   Basic HTML and web skills essential   Thorough understanding of information architecture principles and practices   Knowledge of Microsoft and Google business applications preferred   Advanced knowledge of Learning Management Systems (LMS), Educational Management Systems, or Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems preferred   Familiarity with SAFe Agile principles   Working knowledge of accessibility standards (Section 508, WCAG 2.0) is a plus   Technologically proficient (especially with Microsoft Office programs and the Google Suite; HTML experience is a plus   Proficiency with a variety of style manuals, including  The Chicago Manual of Style   Primary Location:  US-RE-Remote Other Locations  US-MD-Columbia Work Locations:  US-Remote Remote Job:  Publishing Organization:  North America Employee Status:  Regular Employee Job Type:  Standard Shift:  Day Job Job Posting:  Jan 19, 2021 Job Unposting:  Jan 23, 2021 Schedule:  Full-time Regular Req ID:  2011495 Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. Report this job Direct message the job poster from Dynamic Campus Shansa Dahlin Recruiting Top Technical Talent at Dynamic Campus - We Are Hiring!  Production Media Manager Job Description The Production Media Manager is responsible for all operation of multimedia production/post-production and live streaming of webinars, conferences, and live events: this includes, but is not limited to, the artistic design and setup of the venues and recording spaces, support, training, and maintenance related to managing and maintaining the university’s multimedia technology, venue areas, conference rooms, classrooms, and production spaces. They will work collaboratively across the University to investigate, promote, and support new and existing technologies that enhance teaching, learning and research through media production. They will also work closely with the Office of Public Affairs to ensure the brand standards of the university are met. This position is also responsible for multimedia production in support of online course design, lectures, seminars, and any events held for private and public consumption. In addition, it is the responsibility of the Production Media Manager to archive and preserve data files for both historical and disaster recovery purposes. This position is also responsible for support of the A/V technology located at UMary, and manages the Media Production Technicians and the Media Production Student Assistants. The Production Media Manager position reports directly to the CIO. Responsibilities: Clearly communicates and develops production plans for each live event or production. Develops and maintains a production calendar ensuring that equipment is available for production and classroom use as needed. Audio, video, photographic, and digital production, and post-production of UMARY lectures, labs, live events, presentations, and meetings for dissemination to students, staff, and faculty Editing of raw footage and creation of high-quality video content Design and creation of audio, graphics, and editing into finished content Supports the designs and assists in the implementation of online courses. Records special events as requested by University staff Receives, reviews, prioritizes, and ensures completion of all requests for media services Ensures that recordings are transferred to video streaming server as needed or requested by faculty Archives and preserves data files for both historical and disaster recovery purposes Research new media-based educational technologies and works with the academics on selection and implementation Maintains inventory and manages life cycle of all production equipment and spaces. Drives customer satisfaction and demonstrates strong customer service orientation. Demonstrates effective interpersonal, communication, and conflict resolution skills. Authors technical documentation and ensures that it is updated to remain current. Provides one-on-one user training as needed. Assists with the daily scheduling of technology usage. Sets-up classroom A/V equipment to meet faculty needs, which include computer, video recording and projection needs. Trouble-shoots repair requests in a timely manner Performs operational check-ups of classroom A/V equipment. Performs or arranges repair of equipment as needed Monitor supply inventory and equipment. Research new technology and acquires supplies and equipment as needed Provides consultation on the updating of classroom technology Assists with the implementation and training of operation to faculty and staff employees Records classes as needed or requested by faculty Assists with management of supplies inventory and equipment Research alternative supplies and equipment costs Rents equipment as needed Assists with the implementation and training of operation to faculty and staff employees Oversees and manages Media Production staff. Performs staff management functions including staff performance appraisals Ensures policies and procedures are administered properly and problem resolution is achieved within stated service levels Assists with the development of department policies, budgets, plans, quotes, and requisitions. Supervise employees and student workers as applicable Responds to faculty, student, and staff requests for support as it relates to IT supported A/V and media production equipment and systems Works with vendors on issue resolution of third-party supported applications Resolves issues from distance learning Helpdesk requests Trains and assists faculty with proper integration of technology in the classroom Other duties as assigned Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in communications, media production, related field, or an equivalent combination of experience, education, and training Experience and understanding of media management At least 3 years’ experience in post/live media production Demonstrated experience with industry standard audio/visual hardware and software. Understanding of media in teaching and learning. Experience with streaming and web distribution is preferred. Proficiency with creating, editing, and producing audio, video and photographic media is required. Preferred training and project management experience Demonstrated excellence in teamwork as well as excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills Ability to work a flexible schedule as needed Attention to detail and thorough documentation Ability to work with a range of technical staff to develop joint solutions Strong understanding of technical troubleshooting methodology Strong critical thinking skills Strong customer service skills and demonstrated responsiveness to customer needs Strong analytical skills Systems administration and PC support experience is a plus Show more Show less Referrals increase your chances of interviewing at Dynamic Campus by 2x See who you know Turn on job alerts Media Production Manager in Bismarck, ND On Off Apply for  Media Production Manager  at  Dynamic Campus Enter your email to apply with your existing LinkedIn profile, or to create a new one. Report this job Job Information As a Business Analyst you will evaluate business operations to understand gaps and opportunities through development and analysis of reports in the Aftermarket Parts, Service, and Attachment division of Doosan Bobcat. This position is responsible for analyzing requirements and recommending solutions which enable the business unit to achieve goals within established strategies. The ideal candidate for this role works well in an autonomous environment and is detail oriented, highly analytical, and inquisitive. Role & Responsibility   Provide accurate, timely and informative business information and insights to key-decision makers within the company.   Perform audits of master data.   Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.   Provide business and systems expertise in identifying, evaluating, and developing specifications and procedures that meet user requirements.   Train users to utilize reporting and decision-making models.   Gather user feedback for enhancements and development needs.   Job Requirement   Education: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field.   Experience: 2>5 years.   High degree of math and statistical skills/understanding.   Oracle experience preferred.   Data mining and analytics experience preferred.   High degree of fluency in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint.   Must have a high level of motivation and individual initiative.   Excellent analytical/problem solving skills, communication skills.   Travel: <15%.   Doosan Bobcat North America will not sponsor applicants for work visas, nor provide any OPT, CPT or other immigration support, for this position. #zrco #gd Doosan Bobcat, a leading global manufacturer of construction, agriculture and landscaping equipment, attachments and services, is committed to empowering people to accomplish more. As a part of the Doosan Group, which employs more than 43,000 people in 38 countries worldwide, the company offers its customers products and solutions to help build stronger businesses and communities. Based in Seoul, South Korea, with its North America headquarters in West Fargo, North Dakota, Doosan Bobcat is home to world-renowned brands. This includes: Bobcat® compact equipment; Doosan Portable Power products; BOB-CAT Mowers; Ryan and Steiner grounds care equipment; and Geith attachments. At Doosan Bobcat, our success is powered by our people. Through our winning culture and one global team working together, we deliver the best products and service to our customers – and make the world a better place. Join our team today and start building your career with a worldwide leader. Doosan is committed to a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, age, race, color, religion, creed, citizenship status, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by law. Individuals with disabilities who require a reasonable accommodation in the application process or who need assistance accessing the information on this website should call 701-241-8700. Doosan is a VEVRAA federal contractor and seeks priority referrals of protected veterans. Beware of Fraudulent Job Offers and Solicitations Any legitimate job offer will be preceded by an official selection process. Report this job Job Description Spherion Staffing has an opening for an experienced HR Generalist in Bismarck, ND. The Human Resource Generalist will advise, coach, counsel and provide guidance to managers and employees on policies, procedures, programs, employee relations, performance management and other human resources areas. The HR Generalist will assist in the day-to-day operations and coverage of the Human Resource department; assist in the administration and communication of benefits plans and programs. Qualified applicants should have minimum of 5 years' experience in compensation and benefits, BA in HR and SHRM/HRCI certification preferred. Pay $16-25/hour DOE Schedule: M-F, 8-5pm Responsibilities:  Manage benefit programs including annual open enrollment  Reconcile invoices for accuracy  Responsible for HR compliance and filing requirements such as 5500's, eeo-1, 1095's  Design a compensation package based on business goals and strategy  Create a consistent compensation guideline that matches our work and organizational culture  Create and analyze job descriptions evaluations and classifications with leadership involvement  Conduct salary and labor market research to define benchmarks  Assess employees needs by conducting organizational surveys  Keep abreast with new trend and best practice in the filed  Ensure that compensation practices are in compliance with current laws and regulations  Conduct periodic audits, prepare and present reports  Manage unemployment correspondence  Complete verification of employment Responsibilities: See above Working hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM Skills: Requirements: BA in human resources, business administration or similar relevant field SHRM/HRCI certification preferred Minimum of 5 years' experience in compensation and benefits Good understanding of full cycle hiring process Familiarity with current employment rules and regulations Hands on experience with HR software (HRIS) Hands on experience with quantitative and qualitative research Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Education: Bachelors Experience: 4-7 years Qualifications: See above To be considered, please apply online at www.spherion.com/apply or if you have questions you can reach out to John Funk at 701-298-8300 Spherion has helped thousands of people just like you find work happiness! Our experienced staff will listen carefully to your employment needs and then work diligently to match your skills and qualifications to the right job and company.
